scan.regex: .*CAN received...triggering resend
scan.message: This indicates that a Message Collision happened on the Z-Wave network and the message will be reattempted. If you get lots of these messages it indicates a RF Interference Issues

scan.regex: .*ERROR: Dropping command because node is presumed dead
scan.message: A Message sent to ${node} was dropped as the Controller has assumed the node is Dead

scan.regex: .*ERROR: Dropping command, expected response not received after (\d*) attempt(s)
scan.message: A Message sent to ${node} was dropped as we retried to send the message ${1} time(s) but it did not respond

scan.regex: .*ERROR: .* could not be delivered to Z-Wave stack
scan.message: A Message sent to ${node} was dropped as the Controller rejected it. Please report to Developers

scan.regex: .*IsPolled setting for valueId (.*) is not consistent with the poll list
scan.message: There is a Internal Corruption on the Polling Structures. Please report to Developers

scan.regex: .*Options have not been created and locked. Exiting...
scan.message: The Options have not been setup before starting the Driver. This is a Application Implementation Error. Please report to the Application Developers

scan.regex: .*mgr, Manager::GetDriver failed - Home ID (.*) is unknown
scan.message: The Application has requested a homeid of ${1} which is not valid. This is a Application Implementation Error. Please report to the Application Developers

scan.regex: .*mgr, SetPollIntensity failed - Driver with Home ID (.*) is not available
scan.message: The Application has requested a homeid of ${1} which is not valid. This is a Application Implementation Error. Please report to the Application Developers

scan.regex: .*WARNING: node revived
scan.message: The Node ${node} has returned after the Controller assumed it was Dead.

scan.regex: .*ERROR: node presumed dead
scan.message: A Message sent to ${node} was dropped as the Controller has assumed the node is Dead

scan.regex: .*Cannot find a path to the configuration files at (.*), Using (.*) instead...
scan.message: A attempt to Open the Config files at ${1} failed. Not a critical error as the Library will try different paths before Erroring Out (Next Path : ${2})

scan.regex: .*Cannot find a path to the configuration files at .*\. Exiting...
scan.message: The Library could not open any Config files and tried different locations. Please check the location of your config files.

scan.regex: .*Options are already final (locked)\.
scan.message: The Application has attempted to Modify the Options after starting the Driver. This is a Application Implementation Error. Please report to the Application Developers

scan.regex: .*Options have been locked. No more may be added\.
scan.message: The Application has attempted to Modify the Options after starting the Driver. This is a Application Implementation Error. Please report to the Application Developers

scan.regex: .*Recieved a Unsolicited MultiChannelEncap when we are not in QueryState_Instances
scan.message: The Node {node} has Sent a Unsolicited Message. Please report to the Developers

scan.regex: .*ERROR: Cannot open serial port (.*)\. Error code (.*)
scan.message: The Library was unable to open the Serial Port ${1}. The Error Was ${2}. Please check you have specified the correct serial port

scan.regex: .*Cannot find endpoint map to instance for Command Class .* endpoint .*
scan.message: A Internal Error in the Library occurred. Please report to the Developers

scan.regex: .*Recieved a MultiChannelEncap for endpoint .* for Command Class .*, which we can't find
scan.message: A Internal Error in the Library occurred. Please report to the Developers

scan.regex: .*ERROR: Cannot get exclusive lock for serial port (.*)\. Error code (.*)
scan.message: The Serial Port ${1} is possibly being used by another Application. The Error Was ${2}. Please check you have specified the correct serial port and no other applications are running

scan.regex: .*ERROR: Parity not supported
scan.message: The Serial Port does not support Parity. Please report to the developers

scan.regex: .*ERROR: Stopbits not supported
scan.message: The Serial Port does not support Parity. Please report to the developers

scan.regex: .*Baud rate not supported
scan.message: The Serial Port does not the requested speed. Please report to the developers

scan.regex: .*ERROR: Failed to set serial port parameters
scan.message: The Serial Port does not the requested speed. Please report to the developers

scan.regex: .*ERROR: Failed to open serial port (.*)
scan.message: The Library was unable to open the Serial Port ${1}. Please check you have specified the correct serial port

scan.regex: .*ERROR: Serial port must be opened before writing
scan.message: A Internal Error Occurred. Please report to the Developers

scan.regex: .*Cannot find specified HID port with VID:(.*) and PID:(.*)\.
.*Failed to open HID port (.*)
scan.message: The Library was unable to open the USB Device ${1}. Please check you have specified the correct USB Device ID's

scan.regex: .*HIDAPI ERROR STRING (if any): (.*)
scan.message: The USB Device reported a Error: ${1} Please report to the Developers

scan.regex: .*ERROR: Not enough data in stream buffer
scan.message: An Internal Error Occurred. Please report to the Developers

scan.regex: .*ERROR: Not enough space in stream buffer
scan.message: An Internal Error Occurred. Please report to the Developers

scan.regex: .*ERROR: Failed to read serial port state
scan.message: An Internal Error Occurred. Please report to the Developers

scan.regex: .*ERROR: Failed to set serial port state
scan.message: An Internal Error Occurred. Please report to the Developers

scan.regex: .*ERROR: Failed to set serial port timeouts
scan.message: An Internal Error Occurred. Please report to the Developers

scan.regex: .*ERROR: Serial port write \((.*)\)
scan.message: An Internal Error Occurred ${1}. Please report to the Developers

scan.regex: .*WARNING: Failed to init the controller \(attempt (.*)\)
scan.message: An error occurred while trying to Open the Controller. Please report to the Developers

scan.regex: .*WARNING: Driver::ReadConfig - (.*) is from an older version of OpenZWave and cannot be loaded.
scan.message: The file ${1} is from a older version of OpenZWave. Please delete these file and restart OZW if this message persists

scan.regex: .*WARNING: Driver::ReadConfig - Home ID in file (.*) is incorrect
scan.message: The File ${1} contains a incorrect HomeID. Please remove this file and restart your application if this message persists

scan.regex: .*WARNING: Driver::ReadConfig - Home ID is missing from file (.*)
scan.message: The File ${1} does not contain a HomeID. Please remove this file and restart your application if this message persists

scan.regex: .*WARNING: Driver::ReadConfig - Controller Node ID in file (.*) is incorrect
scan.message: The File ${1} contains incorrect Controller Node ID. Please remove this file and restart your application if this message persists

scan.regex: .*WARNING: Driver::ReadConfig - Node ID is missing from file (.*)
scan.message: The File ${1} does not contain a Node ID. Please remove this file and restart your application if this message persists

scan.regex: .*WARNING: Tried to write driver config with no home ID set
scan.message: The Application triggered a WriteConfig but the library does not have a valid HomeID. This is a Application Implementation Error. Please report to the Application Developers

scan.regex: .*WARNING: Device is not a sleeping node.
scan.message: A Message sent to ${node} was not acknowledged, and does not support the WakeUP CC. This device may be disabled or offline

scan.regex: .*WARNING: 50ms passed without finding the length byte...aborting frame read
scan.message: A error was encountered communicating with the Controller. If this message repeats it may indicate a problem and you should report it to the Developers

scan.regex: .*WARNING: 500ms passed without reading the rest of the frame...aborting frame read
scan.message: A error was encounters communicating with the Controller. If this message repeats it may indicate a problem and you should report it to the Developers

scan.regex: .*WARNING: Checksum incorrect - sending NAK
scan.message: A message received from the Controller was corrupted. If this message repeats it may indicate a problem with the Controller and you should report it to the Developers

scan.regex: .*m_currentMsg was NULL when trying to set MaxSendAttempts
scan.message: An Internal Error Occurred. Please report to the Developers

scan.regex: .*WARNING: NAK received...triggering resend
scan.message: A message sent to the Controller was corrupted. If this message repeats it may indicate a problem with the Controller and you should report it to the Developers

scan.regex: .*WARNING: Out of frame flow! .*\. Sending NAK.
scan.message: This message could indicate you have selected the wrong Serial Port. Please check your serial port and if the message persists, please report it to the Developers

scan.regex: .*WARNING: Received reply to FUNC_ID_ZW_REQUEST_NETWORK_UPDATE - command failed
scan.message: A Request to update the Network Topology failed. If you continue to receive this message, please report it to the Developers

scan.regex: .*WARNING: Received reply to FUNC_ID_ZW_ASSIGN_RETURN_ROUTE - command failed
scan.message: A request for a Node to update its Routing Table failed. if you continue to receive this message, please report it to the Developers

scan.regex: .*WARNING: Received reply to FUNC_ID_ZW_DELETE_RETURN_ROUTE - command failed
scan.message: A request for a Node to update its Routing Table failed. if you continue to receive this message, please report it to the Developers

scan.regex: .*WARNING: Received reply to FUNC_ID_ZW_REMOVE_FAILED_NODE_ID - (.*)
scan.message: A request to remove a Failed Node Failed: ${1}. If the node has not failed, you should just unpair it instead

scan.regex: .*WARNING: Received reply to FUNC_ID_ZW_IS_FAILED_NODE_ID - node (.*) failed
scan.message: The Controller Believes that the ${node} has failed. You should check it is operating correctly

scan.regex: .*Received reply to FUNC_ID_ZW_IS_FAILED_NODE_ID - node (.*) has not failed
scan.message: The Controller has confirmed that ${node} has not failed. This is a informational message only

scan.regex: .*WARNING: Received reply to FUNC_ID_ZW_REPLACE_FAILED_NODE - command failed
scan.message: A request to remove a Failed Node Failed: ${1}. If the node has not failed, you should just unpair it instead.

scan.regex: .*WARNING: Received reply to FUNC_ID_ZW_DELETE_RETURN_ROUTE - command failed
scan.message: A request for a Node to update its Routing Table failed. if you continue to receive this message, please report it to the Developers

scan.regex: .*WARNING: Unexpected Callback ID received
scan.message: This is a Internal Error. Please report it to the Developers

scan.regex: .*WARNING: Received reply to FUNC_ID_ZW_REQUEST_NETWORK_UPDATE: Failed - Error. Process aborted.
scan.message: A Request to update the Network was aborted. Please retry this and if this message persists, please report it to the Developers

scan.regex: .*WARNING: Received reply to FUNC_ID_ZW_REQUEST_NETWORK_UPDATE: Failed - SUC is busy.
scan.message: A Request to update the Network failed as the SUC Node was Busy. Please retry this and if this message persists, please report it to the Developers

scan.regex: .*WARNING: Received reply to FUNC_ID_ZW_REQUEST_NETWORK_UPDATE: Failed - SUC is disabled.
scan.message: A Request to update the Network has failed as the SUC node is disabled. Please check your SUC node and retry. if this message persists, please report it to the Developers

scan.regex: .*WARNING: Received reply to FUNC_ID_ZW_REQUEST_NETWORK_UPDATE: Failed - Overflow. Full replication required.
scan.message: A Request to update the Network has failed. Please retry this and if this message persists, please report it to the Developers

scan.regex: .*Remove Node Failed - NodeID 0 Returned
scan.message: A Request remove a Node Failed. Please retry this and if this message persists, please report it to the Developers

scan.regex: .*WARNING: Node is 0 but not enough data to perform alternative match.
scan.message: This is a Internal Error. Please report it to the Developers

scan.regex: .*WARNING: REMOVE_NODE_STATUS_FAILED
scan.message: This is a Internal Error. Please report it to the Developers

scan.regex: .*WARNING: LEARN_MODE_FAILED
scan.message: This is a Internal Error. Please report it to the Developers

scan.regex: .*WARNING: Received reply to FUNC_ID_ZW_REMOVE_FAILED_NODE_ID - Node (.*) is OK, so command failed
scan.message: A Attempt to remove failed node for node ${1} failed as the Controller believes this node is OK. Maybe you should just unpair the node instead.

scan.regex: .*WARNING: Received reply to FUNC_ID_ZW_REMOVE_FAILED_NODE_ID - unable to move node (.*) to failed nodes list
scan.message: A Attempt to remove failed node for node ${1} failed as the Controller believes this node is OK. Maybe you should just unpair the node instead.

scan.regex: .*WARNING: REQUEST_NEIGHBOR_UPDATE_FAILED
scan.message: A Request for ${node} to update its Neighbor Table failed. If you receive this message often, please report it to the Developers.

scan.regex: .*WARNING: FUNC_ID_ZW_APPLICATION_UPDATE: UPDATE_STATE_NODE_INFO_REQ_FAILED received
scan.message: This is a Internal Error. Please report it to the Developers

scan.regex: .*Poll queue hasn't been able to execute for 300 secs or more
scan.message: The Poll Thread has not been able to run for more than 5 minutes. This might indicate a overloaded machine or network

scan.regex: .*WARNING: Driver::ReadButtons - zwbutton.xml is malformed
scan.message: This is a Internal Error. Please report it to the Developers

scan.regex: .*WARNING: Driver::ReadButtons - zwbutton.xml is from an older version of OpenZWave and cannot be loaded.
scan.message: The zwbutton.xml file is from a old version of OpenZWave. Please delete this file and restart your application

scan.regex: .*WARNING: Driver::ReadButtons - cannot find Button Id for node %d
scan.message: This is a Internal Error. Please report it to the Developers

scan.regex: .*WARNING: Received reply to FUNC_ID_ZW_SET_SLAVE_LEARN_MODE - command failed
scan.message: This is a Internal Error. Please report it to the Developers

scan.regex: .*Invalid Network Key. Does not contain 16 Bytes - Contains (.*)
scan.message: The Network Key must contain 16 Bytes (Characters). It only contains ${1}. Please update it.

scan.regex: .*Cannot Convert Network Key Byte (.*) to Key
scan.message: The Byte ${1} in the Network Key is invalid. Please update it

scan.regex: .*mgr, LogDriverStatistics() failed - _homeId (.*) not found
scan.message: A call to LogDriverStatistics contained a invalid HomeID ${1} - Please report this to the Application Developers

scan.regex: .*Specified option [(.*)] was not found.
scan.message: A Request for a Option Key ${1} was not found. Please report this to the Application Developers

scan.regex: .*Failed to Parse (.*): (.*)
scan.message: The File ${1} is malformed. The Error is ${2}. You should either correct the file, or remove it.

scan.regex: .*Day Value was greater than range. Setting to Invalid
scan.message: The Day Value returned from the ClimateControlScheduleCC or ClockCC was invalid. This is usually a device bug

scan.regex: .*overrideState Value was greater than range. Setting to Invalid
scan.message: The OverRideState value returned from the ClimateControlScheduleCC from the device was out of range. This is usually a device bug

scan.regex: .*Invalid XML - (.*) Attribute is wrong type or missing
scan.message: Either the OpenZWave State files, or one of the config files was corrupted when trying to read the ${1} attribute. You should consult the log in more detail to determine which file has a issue

scan.regex: .*Got Unhandled Child Entry in TriggerRefreshValue XML Config: .*
scan.message: The RefreshClassValue entry in one of the Device Config files is not correct. Please report this to a Developer

scan.regex: .*Failed to add a RefreshClassValue from XML
scan.message: The RefreshClassValue entry in one of the Device Config files is not correct. Please report this to a Developer

scan.regex: .*Can't get Node
scan.message: An attempt to refresh other ClassValues failed as we could not locate the affected Node. Please report this to the developers.

scan.regex: .*LockState Value was greater than range. Setting to Invalid
scan.message: The value sent back by the DoorLock CC for the lockstate variable was our of range. Please report this to a developer

scan.regex: .*Recieved a Unsupported Door Lock Config Report .*
scan.message: The DoorLock CC from a device sent back a Unsupported Config Report. Please report this to a Developer

scan.regex: .*DoorLock::SetValue - Unhandled System_Config Variable .*
scan.message: A Invalid ValueID was sent to the DoorLock CC. This is usually a application related error

scan.regex: .*Failed To Retrieve .* For SetValue
scan.message: OpenZWave could not retrieve the correct type of ValueID's when sending commands to the DoorLock CC. This is usually a application related error

scan.regex: .*RequestValue _valueEnum was greater than range. Dropping
scan.message: A attempt to retrieve a value from the EnergyProduction CC was out of range. This is usually a Application related error

scan.regex: .*(.*) was greater than range. Dropping Message
scan.message: A value returned from the one of the CommandClasses was out of range (${1}). Please report this to a developer

scan.regex: .*m_endPointFindIndex is higher than range. Not Sending MultiChannelCmd_EndPointFind message
scan.message: A value returned from the one of the CommandClasses was out of range (${1}). Please report this to a developer

scan.regex: .*m_endPointFindIndex is higher than range. Not Sending MultiChannelCmd_EndPointFind message
scan.message: A value returned from the one of the CommandClasses was out of range (${1}). Please report this to a developer

scan.regex: .*Failed to Init AES Engine
scan.message: A Internal Error Occurred. Please report to the Developers

scan.regex: .*Failed to Set Initial Network Key for Encryption
scan.message: A Internal Error Occurred. Please report to the Developers

scan.regex: .*Failed to Set Initial Network Key for Authentication
scan.message: A Internal Error Occurred. Please report to the Developers

scan.regex: .*Failed to Generate Encrypted Network Key for Encryption
scan.message: A Internal Error Occurred. Please report to the Developers

scan.regex: .*Failed to Generate Encrypted Network Key for Authentication
scan.message: A Internal Error Occurred. Please report to the Developers

scan.regex: .*Failed to set Encrypted Network Key for Encryption
scan.message: A Internal Error Occurred. Please report to the Developers

scan.regex: .*Failed to set Encrypted Network Key for Authentication
scan.message: A Internal Error Occurred. Please report to the Developers

scan.regex: .*Failed to Decrypt Packet
scan.message: A attempt to decrypt a encrypted packet from a device failed. Please ensure your Network Key is valid.

scan.regex: .*Already Received a SecurityCmd_SchemeReport from the node. Ignoring
scan.message: The Device resent a SchemeReport message to us. If you receive lots of these messages, please report it to a developer

scan.regex: .*No common security scheme. The device will continue as an unsecured node.
scan.message: OpenZWave and the Device could not find a Common Security Scheme to use for encryption. This could indicate a new protocol change. Please report it to a Developer

scan.regex: .*Failed to Encrypt Packet
scan.message: A attempt to decrypt a encrypted packet from a device failed. Please ensure your Network Key is valid.

scan.regex: .*MAC Authentication of Packet Failed. Dropping
scan.message: A Encrypted message was received that appears corrupted. If you receive lots of these messages, please report it to a Developer

scan.regex: .*Failed Initial ECB Encrypt of Auth Packet
scan.message: A Internal Error Occurred. Please report to the Developers

scan.regex: .*Failed Subsequent \(.*\) ECB Encrypt of Auth Packet
scan.message: A Internal Error Occurred. Please report to the Developers

scan.regex: .*Failed Final ECB Encrypt of Auth Packet
scan.message: A Internal Error Occurred. Please report to the Developers

scan.regex: .* Value was greater than range. Dropping
scan.message: A value returned from the one of the CommandClasses was out of range (${1}). Please report this to a developer

scan.regex: .*Scale Value for .* was greater than range. Setting to empty
scan.message: A value returned from the one of the CommandClasses was out of range (${1}). Please report this to a developer

scan.regex: .*UserCodeCmd_Get with Index 0 not Supported
scan.message: An attempt to retrieve the UserCode at Index 0 was requested, which is a invalid location. This is usually a Application error. Please report to your application developers

scan.regex: .*User Code length .* is larger then .*
scan.message: A Internal Error Occurred. Please report to the Developers

scan.regex: .*Unusual response: WakeUpCmd_IntervalReport with len = .*. Ignored.
scan.message: The Device sent a unusual wakeup IntervalReport message. Please report this to the developers
